Text: Jeff Skilling to Present Enrons Network Strategy at the next SOC Meeting Cc Strategic Oversight Committee meeting will be held Tuesday August th at pm in room EBC The topic of this meeting will be E nron s Network Strategy Jeff Skilling will present a description of this strategy as articulated to the analyst community as well as internal management groups throughout Enron To clarify the last SOC meeting addressed a possible shift in asset and finance strategy from a merchant to a strategic orientation in an environment which emphasized the importance of establishing an integrated network This SOC meeting will attempt to lay o ut the strategy more broadly and discuss its implication for Enron North Americas specific businesses The following are some potential talking points to think about before the meeting What are the benefits to Enron North America of thinking about our businesses as an integrated network or series of networks as opposed to individual businesses What are the drawbacks How do our current skill sets of finance assets physical and risk management fit into the network Are different skills required How does communications fit into Enrons core business How is it different What is the role of the customer within the network What role do marke ts play What types of assets are important in building the network Which are n o longer important How can we more accurately describe the role of tradingrisk management in the context of the network What should trading be called Due to the unique opportunity to hear the informative presentation by Jeff Skilling at this SOC meeting please feel free to invite nonSOC members Please RSVP your attendance to my assistant Carol Brown We look forward to seeing you on Tuesday August th
